Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Great budget Andriod Tablet & the BEST bang for $
Item.Review:
Pros: Light, very responsive for single core CPU, 16GB Storage & Stable Android OS
Cons: 7" screen & hard to access MicroSD Slot
Pro: 1. Affordable so Perfect for starter Tablet 2. Solid built & Light. 3. Very Responsive touchpad, even the built-in keyboard is g8. 4. Good sound quality 5. 16GB built-in storage for the price 6. MicroSD for extra Storage 7. very stable OS. In a month usage, haven't reboot or hang even once
Cons: 1. 7" screen, what do you expect from the price 2. Single Core CPU, again what do you expect from the price 3. MicroSD slot is hard to access bec. you pretty much have to pry the cover to open 4. Bloatware apps, but easy to remove...well except for Lenovo App market, which is a google market "wanna-be" ... , which will stuck there forever 5. Camera quality sucks....my android phone takes a better/sharper picture expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, good price!
The product is excellent. I've had it for 4 months now, and haven't had any problems. The features are worth the money paid. Battery life is long for on the go people. Movies are played in great quality; overall quality of everything is high. GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE I PAID! I am very happy with my purchase!

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Just the right size
Cons: No complaints
I bought this device for my wife. She likes to browse the web and play card games. She also likes Netflix movies and books from both Amazon AND Barnes and Noble. This device is admirably suited to these tasks. The android market is filled with fun casual games and Lenovo's mostly hands off version of the android operating system runs smoothly on the tablet. The Wi-Fi is pretty good at picking up the signal from our netgear router at reasonable ranges. (Avoid Belkin routers, androids seem to dislike them) The device is sturdy, easy to use, reliable and very portable. While not quite the machine the K1 is, it is nonetheless a perfect addition to our household technology. I've found it so easy to use and understand I'm getting one fo ... r my mother for her birthday. Mom is legally blind but can still see things if they are close enough. The bright, clear screen on the A1 is just the ticket to replace her aging desktop WinXP machine. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: For the price this was a slam dunk winner!
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, functions, size, and the services are not tied to a specific company
Cons: Battery time is around 5 hours and recharging is about the same. Other than this, it ROCKS!
It's like having a PC at your fingertips. First understand, this is not an Apple product, or a full wireless tablet. . In my opipnion, it is a solid tablet, well built and for the price, This will not dissapoint the layman, business person, or student. This tablet is like having a PC at your fingertips !

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Lenovo couldn't put out the Fire...
Item.Review:
Pros: Form factor and price.
Cons: Lots of features, but many are low-grade.
I currently own an iPad 2 that I'm very pleased with, but I've had my eye on the smaller 7" form factor android tablets as an in-between device for my iPhone and iPad. This was my first purchase of an android device and I did quite a bit of research online before pulling the trigger. Many reviews of the Lenovo A1 were quite favorable and I really wanted to like this tablet, but once in my hands I was disappointed. Before I begin, this has to be the most feature-packed 7" tablet on the market at this price point. The most notable features being the 16GB of storage and a built-in GPS radio. However, it's readily apparent that some crucial corners were cut to arrive at a $199 price, and my runner-up pic ... k was the more spartan Kindle Fire. The most egregious shortcoming is the LCD panel which, at a respectable resolution of 1024x600 and featuring capacitive touch, has almost no viewing angle off center. More peculiar is that the viewing angle is significantly worse to the left when holding in portrait view, making it necessary to actually tilt the screen up on the right to read it clearly. Colors also appear slightly washed out and overall contrast is poor, despite any fine tuning. Another short-coming is the 1ghz single-core processor. The GUI was very clunky and stuttery and I found myself having to double-tap or double-swipe the screen to get the desired reaction. Needless to say, I returned this tablet after a few days of frustration and ended up purchasing the Kindle Fire. I will post a review of my Kindle Fire soon, but in short order I can say LCD panel quality of the Fire is far superior to the A1, and the dual-core processor of the Fire vs. single core processor A1 makes for a much more fluid user experience. On another note, out of the box the Lenovo A1 is much more open with access to the Google Market. In contrast, the Kindle Fire is locked into the Amazon store - but underneath it all lies the same Android 2.3 Operating system. But it's very easy to get to t ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: good price, quaility
Cons: battery life, lag, design
It was my 1st review for the tablet. I have been using it 2 days now. It was not a bad tablet for the price. It have nice sound, great display, and gps feature. There are some of the thing I don't like about this tablet is sometimes it lag when you open lots of apps and doesn't work on Skype video chatting but it do work on Google video chat. Overall is a good tablet for the price and who on budget.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: for its price you'll get all you want on a tablet, great for multimedia.. music, movies and ebooks. Easy to connect to the internet and easy to download applications.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: This is just the right size and the right overall feel. I've tried the quad-cores and the dual-cores and they are faster but also cost more. And how many apps do you really need to run and how many times do you have to switch between apps to even notice the difference? I upgraded to ICS and I'll stick with this. I'm officially handing down my Ipad2 to the kids.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Better than a Nook Color but not by much
Item.Review:
Pros: Price and Android system.
Cons: Screen and build
Brought this for my daughter for her Birthday. Had a dead Pixel right out of the box. a few weeks later and it's getting more dead pixels. Price was attractive but disappointing quality. I considered buying another one but then changed my mind when more dead pixels appeared. I now have to ship it back to Lenovo for service. Easy to use, Android system is great. Better than a Nook but there are better tablets out there.
Also had a Lenovo Laptop that I purchased last year. The laptop is falling apart. Literally. Black Friday special with only one speaker. I went to open the laptop this week, lifted the screen and heard a crack. Literally came apart at the hinge. Unacceptable quality. I will never buy another Lenovo p ... roduct again. I'm afraid the dead pixels are only signs of the beginning. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for $199 but must be flashed
Item.Review:
Pros: Once flashed it's a bargain!!!
Cons: Outside in the BRIGHT sun the screen is almost worthless.
When I bought the A1 I thought for $199 with GPS, front/rear cameras, 16 GB internal memory, 1 Ghz processor, 1024x600 pixel screen and solid feel this would be a "no brainer". However, After using it for 10 days I was ready to send it back. The stock OS is really bad and hacked quite a bit from Lenovo. I was getting random reboots galore! However, after doing some research I rooted the A1 and flashed CM7 which gave it NEW life. Downloaded some programs to speed up the A1 plus LCD screen density and this thing really shines. I get great battery life, nice screen resolution and have not had a reboot in 4 weeks! Make sure you do your homework on rooting and flashing. Once you ... understand it, it's pretty simple but if you rush into it you could "brick" your device. Good luck and I like it now! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, price, cameras, speed
Cons: Crashed once, Screen Gets Fingerprints
I had it for about 2 and a half weeks now, and it works great. relatively fast, i was worried about it only having 512mb of RAM, but it works fine, the processor is fine although it only has 1 core. Skype is a little buggy but i don't use it very often. It has crashed once for whatever reason (i don't know why) but other then that it's great, I can take it anywhere. I find myself charging it every 2-3 days, which i am pleased with, i can just go to bed with it charging. Overall it is a great tablet for the price.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Decent price and just the right size
Cons: Screen could be a little better but for the price you can't complain
I have had the tablet about a month. No issues everything works. I changed the launcher to use ADW rather than the built in one it is much faster. I would buy another if I needed another tablet.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Great product. Great size. Great price.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great product. Great size. Great price.
Cons: Boots up a bit slower than I would like
I've owned the Lenovo A1 tablet for under a month. I have tried everything out except the GPS function. It all works very well. I use a "g" wireless network at home, The A1 retrieves websites quickly. I've watched a short downloaded movie, netflix streamed movies, downloaded and listened to my music, done email, bought a kindle book from Amazon, and have been reading a kindle book downloaded (free) from my local library. I even took a photo using the 3mp camera. It all works well. It is hard to think of what I would want it to do better for the price and feature set.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price
I bought this tablet for my young daughter for Christmas. She asked for a kindle but opted for the ideapad. Good battery , the droid OS allows her to get everything she needs and more. Much better option than the kindle or nook. She does everything from Netflix , reading books to playing games and taking pictures. Great device. Glad I bought this..

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: GPS not functioning, poor customer service
Item.Review:
Pros: size, functionality
Cons: GPS, customer service
Received product late November. The tablet was great in many respects but GPS wasn't working. I brought it back to Best Buy, they were out of stock and did not try to fix it. Only option was to mail to Lenovo for repair. Trip to FedEx to ship. Came back from Lenovo with GPS still not working, but now causing a force close. Many many calls and several weeks later, Lenovo promises me a replacement unit, but not til late January, and nothing promised yet for my lost time (several hours in travel, telephone calls, clearing the unit to ship, and reloading apps and re-syncing upon its return), disappointment and frustration. I like the size, feel, resolution, some of the pre-loaded apps. But two months and I still don't have a f ... ully functioning unit or any acknowledgement from Lenovo that this is wrong. They act like they're doing me a favor by simply replacing a faulty unit. Camera not great. But once the GPS works, it will do the basics that I need - email, navigation, web access, e-reader, etc. Good blend of functions at a fair price (if and when it works). This rating would be higher if GPS worked and if customer service were more responsive and apologetic. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Features Easy to use
Cons: Mine died after a week !
Worked Great for a week ! Then would not power on anymore. Features were easy to use and good. But then it would no longer power on and battery light just flashed. Currently it is out for repair !

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: great product, great price, easy to use
Item.Review: I purchased 2 of these; one for my daughter who turned 5 & one for my daughter that turned 10. They use their tablets incessantly!! They play games, read books, search the web, watch movies from Netflix, etc. We haven not had any problems whatsoever. It is easy for my 5 year old to navigate what she wants to do on it. We haven't had any issues with reboots or not charging. The battery has good life and my girls charge them every other day or so. I am planning to buy my son one for Xmas, and am also replacing my oldest daughter's Dell Streak 7 (terrible product, hence the reason Dell no longer makes them) with one too. I also love the charger, as the tablet uses the same mini usb as my phone, therefore it's very simple to charge on the go....especially for kids that are on it a lot.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: Worth the purchase. It's only been a couple of weeks but this tablet is amazing. No issues and it does everything it is supposed to do. Only thing is battery drains a little fast.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Wanted to love this, and still could
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, Lenovo name
Cons: charging ability, Lenovo app shop
This was bought to replace a Vizio which had been exchanged numberous times for its inability to charge, apparently Vizio was aware that this tablet had issues with the charger port, and was allowing them to be sent back to the company for a refund, however I purchased mine at Costco (LOVE COSTCO, best customer service ever!!!!) so I returned it to costco. I found this and had heard from my father a software engineer that Lenovo was a good brand. Oh and this tablet was purchased for my 7 year old daughter whom loved it and I did the charging to avoid any issues. Now it won't charge, we have tried different chargers, plugs, you name it. I had my father look at it and he believes there may be a crack near th ... e charging port so I am investigating what if any options I have, I will update my results. As far as the Lenovo app shop it doesn't offer all the apps we would like and it is not very easy to use google to get apps. Thanks for reading. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: I like the fast response, the light touch required to select items and the large 16 GB capacity
Cons: nothing
I purchased this to replace my Pandigital Novel, that died after about 11 months of use. I like the front and back cameras, the larger selection of apps for this vs the Novel. I love the built-in GPS feature that you can follow your progress on the maps. I like the 7" screen size that is more portable than a larger 10" device would be. I like that I can plug this into a boombox input and play internet radio stations thru it, or listen thru headphones. I am very happy with everything about this device.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Great features for the price
I purchased this Lenovo A1 tablet after searching online and also looking the actual devices in several stores. For this price you can buy Lenovo, Kindle Fire, and Blackberry. Kindle is too limited; I do not like the idea to stick to just one book store. The Blackberry bothered me with the so "unique" operating system. So I decided to try Lenovo, and so far I have no regrets. Lenovo has very bold look, the materials used for the body are top quality. Also it has a metal frame (magnesium) which makes the tablet even stronger. The screen is LED, very good quality. The websites look pretty, the pictures and movies are looking great. Overall the product is great. I had some concerns about the OS (it is version 2.3 Gingerbread), and was thinking t ... hat maybe the newer versions like Honeycomb or Ice-cream sandwich will be better, but I did not found any lack of features or functions on Gingerbread. It is a well developed version so I guess I will be alright. I would recommend this tablet to anyone with a limited budget, and no much experience with tablets. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: get your email on the run in urban environments
Cons: battery not user replaceable
It has excellent range, and a lack of finickiness. It has never failed to connect to any network that it should. The "spontaneous reboot" problem was identified only in connection with one app that is known by the app writer to cause this with HTC Android builds.
My use is utilitarian: email and web browsing. It saves getting the laptop out. Others who have more intensive, media oriented perspectives may want more power. An IPS screen would be nice, but I can live without it. The magnesium frame is an important plus, stiffening the assembly so the lousy ROHS solder won't disintegrate so quickly!
The only annoying thing is the lack of a user replaceable battery. This appears ... to be universal. It puzzles how people have gotten used to ecologically unfriendly devices that are designed to be thrown away. However, a peek at the maintenance manual suggests that replacing the battery will not be impractical. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Great value for the price
Cons: Sound quality and screen touch size
I recently purchased this product for personal use but find more and more reasons to use it for my company as well.
Pros: (For the price) The device has excellent battery life, I can read an ebook, surf the web and listen to several podcast for hours before I have to recharge it. Depending of the use I have gone all weekend before charging again.
Video playback is smooth and good quality.
I mostly love that I am not tied to one particular company, so I can choose from multiple companies when I am looking for ebooks or other content.
My toddlers love the apps that I have downloaded for them to play, which is great for those long waits at the doctors office.
Cons: ... The touch portion of the screen is smaller than the actual screen, so things like the letters 'P' and 'Q' as well as the android notification bar can sometimes be hard to hit. I will admit I have not had time to see if this is just a re-calibration issue.
Sound through the single speaker is a little lacking but I bought an adapter for my car and use it to listen to podcasts instead. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Price and Features
Cons: YouTube in full screen
Better than Kindle fire and iPad 2! It is so cheap and great for all of my needs! The only one thing that I didn't like, was the YouTube feature in Firefox. When you turn it sideways to watch a video, it blinks and buffers a little. But other than that, It's great! You can transfer your pictures and music onto it and download apps from the PLAY Store! There is also a Kindle feature to read books.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice build quality, good set of features
Cons: Offensively terrible customer service, poor touch response
I had a lot of trouble with the edge of the screen not responding to touch (for instance the shade wouldn't pull down from the top of the screen and I couldn't get a "p" on the virtual keyboard). I sent it to Lenovo for warranty service and after about 5 phone calls checking the status and responding to the same question over and over from their technician, they sent it back to me unrepaired after two months. Evidently they deemed that this lack of touch response still met their specification. I haven't seen evidence online of other people having this same problem but I'm going to steer clear of Lenovo and IBM from now on.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: Works fine but cant watch Netflix
Item.Review:
Pros: Its fairly fast with a proper net conection
Cons: No Netflix
Upset that you cant watch netflix,read that you could.Was willng to spend the extra money to step up from a poloroid tab, to this, to do so..Wish I had the money back..Works fine for what it is otherwise

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: LENOVO'S GREAT LITTLE 7 TABLET FOR FUN.
Item.Review: GREAT FOR TAKING PHOTOS AND SCANNING PHOTOS. VERY VERY GOOD GPS SYSTEM, W/O INTERNET USE. DECENT ANDROID OPERATING SYSTEM 2.3 EQUALS GINGERBREAD. USES A GOOD TEXAS INSTRUMENT TABLET PROCESSOR. (TI) GREAT LCD SCREEN FOR EXCELLENT VIDEOS AND MOVIES. ONLY HAS 512MB OF ON-BOARD MEMORY. SLOT FOR MICRO-SD CARD EXTRA MEMORY USAGE. HAS VERY GOOD SOUND QUALITY.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.ReviewTitle: I wanted to love my Lenovo tablet
Item.Review: I wanted to love my Lenovo tablet since my first laptop was an IBM Thinkpad.........however, like a few others that posted here- my first experience with the tablet was that it stopped working after about a month (just wouldn't turn on). I wanted the smaller 7" screen, I wanted more versatility than the Kindle Fire, and the price was great- I still remain cautiously optomistic that this new one will last longer than the first one. The good news is that Best Buy took care of me, and I was able to exchange it at the store. I enjoy my Lenovo tablet and would have rated it higher if I did not have difficulty with the first one.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: Returned this product a week after purchasing. Product is not compatible with Belkin routers and I did not find that out until after I bought it and began researching why my WiFi kept going out. On day 8 the tablet suddenly wouldn't cut on anymore. Returned the Lenovo for a Samsung Galaxy.....BEST DECISION EVER!!!! I Love It!!

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: Tons of great features and specs for a great price
Cons: Touchscreen sometimes wonky at far corners
Pros: It's got front and rear webcams that take decent pics/vids = useful
16 gig space = hell yeah!
Gps = useful
expansion slot is nice
vids look great, sound is great
apps = useful
speed = pretty great! not as slow as reviews for kindle fire or nook makes it seem.
cons: Touchscreen is sometimes a little unresponsive at the far corners - Still works, just annoying when you have to press it a few times.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: price
Cons: slow
I was waiting long time, but when I had it, it was a kind of dissapointed, very slow comparing with i-pad, and get dirty very easy with my fingers, battery run out very quick, but the design and graphic are beautiful,

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: perfect size, easy to use
I've enjoyed taking my tablet instead of laptop to vacation areas.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: Great option for low budget! It's easy to use, and nice size too.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: Perfect and simple to use. Gift for tech challenged wife. Less than $200. Email and Facebook use. WOW

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review:
Pros: size
It seemed to be a good product until I couldn't turn it on and had to return.

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: I use the tablet for amusement. I think it??s rather good!

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: Very usefull i enjoy it very much worth every penny

Item.Item: Lenovo 22282EU LVO IP Tablet A1 16GB Droid 2.3-BLK
Item.Review: Small, fast, powerful. 2 cameras, gps, bluetooth. I am really liking this tablet! Like its name, it is A1!
